nodes.bodyText:
I see there are two roles fields in User class.
What's the difference ? Should we add setting for them separately?

Good question.
Roles is something which is maintained by Security Plugin, you think of Internal roles.
Where as backend roles are determined from Authentication provider if the customer has integrated with other systems.
We decided to use backend role because it will be easier for customers so that their roles are automatically updated when there are changes in their organization rather opendistro internal roles.

What if the searchSourceBuilder.query() is not a BoolQueryBuilder ?
For example, one user want to count all anomaly result. That will be just an aggregation query. For this case we will not add this filterBackendRoles term query to the original query, then user can get total anomaly result count for all users.
Any updates? If it's not easy to build a flexible solution. How about we start from supporting BoolQueryBuilder like alerting ? We can support more query types in future.

Yeah, its getting tricky support other queries, I spent some time to figure out if there is a cleaner way of doing it.
Like you said, lets start supporting the bool query and we can add support to the other queries if needed later.
I will handle queries with an error for now.
Another possible case: old user created before FGAC enabled?

Not really, this AuthHeader will not exist when security is disabled, this has nothing to do with FGAC. It is how security plugin works. Old user or any user will always have its credentials while logging in.
Security plugin will intercept and recheck user's permission on anomaly result index ? If not map read access of anomaly result index to this user role, security plugin will block and return error?
By the time the request comes to the Transport layer, the request is already authenticated i.e security plugin would have checked the permissions of the user.
Got it, so we are safe to stash thread context in line 71 to pass transport layer check, otherwise, security plugin will recheck user role permission on the index?
Correct. Thats exactly how it works. And we need to stash the context to access system indices.

From this code, we can get authHeader from SearchAnomalyRequest and build authRequest with it, then perform secure REST API call.
Is it possible that we can build authHeader or authRequest  by ourselves without REST request for example in some schedule job ?
From current AbstractSearchAction code line 79, I see we get authHeader from RestRequest 
String authHeader = request.header(ConfigConstants.AUTHORIZATION);

Yeah, its both yes and no : ).
Basically when the security plugin is used, any user who sends a request, the auth header will be set.
For the scheduled job we can do the same by injecting the role and making a rest request.
Instead we are directly calling transport, either way the permissions are being checked.

This is not a comment for this PR. Just curious and ask
I see the AuthUserRequestBuilder hard code auth URL in code. Is it possible/safe to let client define which URL to send request to?
For example,
1.User send REST request to AD
2.AD gets authHeader from user REST request
3.Build auth request to send request to alerting plugin's monitor creation URL?

Definitely, RestClient is generic.
We could use it to call any Rest endpoint from our transport.
Its just we are using a hardcoded API for our security plugin but we can have a generic request builder which we could use it for our monitors.

user backend roles is a list of roles, can this term query work for this case
1.User creates a detector and runs it. At this time, user has roles [ad_view, ad_run, monitor_view]
2.After 1 week, user gets monitor creation and run permission, and his "ad_run" permission gets revoked. So now user has roles [ad_view, monitor_view, monitor_create, monitor_run]
Question:
1.Will the detector still run after the "detector_run" permission get revoked ? Will we check permission for every job execution?
2.Can this term query work for this case ? That means we need to query ad user roles with latest roles [ad_view, monitor_view, monitor_create, monitor_run], but the AD result only contains three old roles [ad_view, ad_run, monitor_view]
Sorry, misunderstand, you are using termsQuery, so it should work from question2. Only need to consider question1.

Correct.
Specifically to answer Q1, we will inject user role for the background job. This will check permissions for every run.
Q2. Exactly terms query will take care of handling multiple roles.

If user use curl to search detector, and they don't use bool query, they can search other user's detector data. So we may have security leak.
How about we build a dedicated API to check if detector name is unique or not. The input is simple a detector name string, the output is true or false. And we control access in java code by ourselves. This needs to change AD Kibana code to switch to this new API.
Yeah sure that sounds good. I will work with Tyler and work on these changes.

Sounds good. Will approve this one. Put the new API in another PR.
BTW, we should throw error for search detectors if not bool query.
